name: nytimes
text:
RT @jacknicas: NEW: A network of 1,300 websites targeting small towns and cities across the U.S. is built not on traditional journalism, but rather propaganda ordered up by Republican groups and P.R. firms.

A nearly yearlong investigation by @daveyalba and me: 
https://t.co/N5c3KpgjdN

name: nytimes
text: Local newspapers are vanishing across the country. Popping up in their place: A network of nearly 1,300 local websites publishing articles ordered up by Republican groups and PR firms. https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU

name: nytimes
text:
The sites appear as ordinary local news outlets, with names like Des Moines Sun and Ann Arbor Times. Most declare that they aim to provide "objective" information but do not disclose that some of the articles are directed by clients.
https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU

name: nytimes
text: For "Maine Business Daily," one reporter was paid $22 to write an article calling Sara Gideon, a Democrat running f… https://t.co/3wDoyIWO4Q

name: nytimes
text: After publication, the reporter received an email from her editor: The “client” who had ordered the article, her editor said, wanted it to include more detail. https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU https://t.co/GA4TJzb17Q

name: nytimes
text: The man largely behind the network itself is Brian Timpone, a former TV reporter who has sought to capitalize on the decline of local news for nearly two decades. He did not respond to requests for comment. https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU https://t.co/7DQqPD3IbD

name: nytimes
text: The political bent of Timpone’s sites has been previously reported, but the extent of the deception has been concealed with confidentiality contracts and a confusing web of companies that run the papers. https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU

name: nytimes
text: Those companies have received at least $2 million from Republican campaigns and conservative think tanks, according to tax records and campaign finance reports. https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU https://t.co/rP8SQUWFy3

name: nytimes
text: We uncovered more details about the operation through interviews with over 30 current and former clients and employees. We reviewed thousands of internal emails and the editing history behind dozens of articles, revealing who requested which ones and how: https://t.co/Xxmg6WkFNU

name: nytimes
text: RT @daveyalba: NEW: A network of 1,300 websites aim to fill a news void left by vanishing local papers across the U.S. It is built on propaganda ordered up by conservative advocacy groups & Republican operators, according to a year-long investigation by me and @jacknicas https://t.co/vyWkXRIZl5
